Introduction
&app; is a free, cross-platform application for displaying and navigating information on a timeline.
Some features of &app;:
Organize events in categories.
Go to a specific date.
Scroll and zoom with mouse wheel.
Different representation depending on zoom level.
The tutorial should contain enough information to get you started using &app;. You are also strongly encouraged to read the section about backups. Later you can come back and read more details about particular topics.
Tutorial
The idea is to display events on a timeline and to be able to quickly change what period in time is shown. An event can be at a specific point in time or span over a period.
Showing the two different types of events (cursor hoovering blue event).
Showing the same timeline as above but with a different zoom level.
To create a new timeline, select New from the File menu and enter a name of a file in the dialog box that opens. This is the name of the file in which information about your events will be stored. Next time you start &app; you can choose to open the same file again. The titlebar always shows which timeline is currently opened.
To add a new event at a specific point in time, double click somewhere on the timeline. This will open a dialog box in which you enter a text for the event. Click the OK button to save the event. Now you will see an event above the horizontal line at the specific point in time that you double clicked on.
&app; automatically saves all changes for you so you never need to manually save your timeline.
To add an event that spans over a period, hold the Ctrl key down, click and drag the mouse to mark a period, and release the mouse button. Again the event dialog box will display and you enter a text for the event and click OK. Now you will also see an event displayed under the horizontal line spanning over the period that you selected.
Events at a specific point in time will always be displayed above the horizontal line. Events spanning over a period will be displayed below the horizontal line most of the time. However, if the period is to small to fit within a few pixels on the screen, it will be displayed above the horizontal line (zooming in will make the event jump from above to below).
To edit an event, double click on it and the event dialog box will appear.
To select an event, just click on it. To select multiple events, hold down the Ctrl key while selecting events. To delete the selected events, press the Delete key.
Try the mouse wheel and you will see the timeline scroll.
Try pressing the left mouse button and drag and you will see the timeline scroll.
Try the mouse wheel while holding the Ctrl key down and you will see the timeline zoom.
The vertical red line indicates the current time.
Hoovering an event will display the full description in the status bar.
Topics in Detail
Backups
&app; tries its best to ensure that the data you save in a timeline never gets lost. One step in that process is to create a backup of your timeline every time before new data is saved. The backup is saved in a file with the same name as the original but with an "~" appended to the name.
If you get an error saying that there was a problem reading timeline data, your backup might save you if the original has been corrupted.
To recover a file from the backup, simply remove the "~" in the name of the backed up file.
If you would like to be extra certain to not loose your data, we recommend that you take regular backups of your timeline file. It can be as simple as copying the original file to another directory.
Creating and Editing Events
Editing event information is done in the dialog shown below.
Dialog to edit events.
It is used both for creating new events and for editing existing ones.
The Create Event dialog can be opened in the following ways:
Select
File Create Event
from the menu.
Double click with the left mouse button on the timeline.
Press the Ctrl key, thereafter hold left mouse button down on the timeline, drag the mouse and release it.
The Edit Event dialog can be opened by double clicking on an event.
The following properties can be defined for an event:
Start
This is the start time of the event if it spans a period, otherwise it is the specific point in time. If used for a period, it has to be less or equal to the end time.
End
This is the end time of the event if it spans a period. This is not used otherwise. If used it has to be greater or equal to the start time.
Text
A free text describing the event.
Category
If you have defined any categories (see section below) you can associate the event with one of your categories. An event can only belong to one category.
The checkboxes at the top of the dialog work as follows:
Period
If checked, both the start and end time will be used to define the period that the event spans. If unchecked only the start time will be enabled and it will specify the specific point in time for the event.
Show time
If checked, you can specify a time for the start and end time in addition to the date. This is useful if you are editing events on a day level where the time is also important. The time will default to 00:00 if not entered.
Close on OK
If checked, the dialog will close when you click OK. Otherwise it will not. This can be used to add multiple events without closing the dialog.
Deleting Events
One or more events can be deleted at the same time. To delete events you first select them and thereafter press the Delete key.
Before the event is deleted the deletion must be acknowledged in the dialog box that appears when the Delete key has been pressed.
An event is selected by clicking within the rectangle representing the event. The event is deselected by clicking on it once again. To select more than one event, hold the Ctrl key down while selecting events.
Categories
Categories are used to group events. An event can only belong to one category. All events that belong to the same category are displayed with the same background color. The color to be used is defined by the category. You can also choose to show or hide all events belonging to a category.
If you want to edit the categories you open the Edit Categories dialog. This is done by selecting
Timeline Edit Categories
from the menu. The dialog looks like this:
Categories Editor.
You create a new category by clicking the Add button and thereafter filling in the attributes of the category in the dialog that appears. The visible checkbox determines if the events belonging to that category should be visible or not. This flag can also be modified in the sidebar ( View Sidebar ).
The Edit Category dialog.
Showing the correspondence between the visible flag in the Edit Category dialog and the sidebar.
You delete a category by selecting it in the listbox and clicking the Delete button or pressing the Delete key. You thereafter have to acknowledge the delete in the dialog that appears. When you delete a category, all the events that belonged to this category are no longer associated with a category.
To edit a category, just double click on it.
Sometimes you forget what color you assigned to a category. To get a quick overview of the active categories you can show the legend ( View Legend ). The legend sits in the lower left corner of the timeline and shows the categories used by events in the current view and the color associated with them. This feature is especially useful when you export the timeline to an image.
Navigation Functions
In addition to the basic navigation functions described in the tutorial there are also a set of navigation functions in the Navigate menu:
Go To Today
Go To Date...
Fit Year
Fit Month
Fit Day
Go To Today scrolls the timeline until the current date is at the center of the screen.
Go To Date has the same functionality as Go To Today with the exception that the user selects the date in a dialog.
The Go to Date dialog.
The Show Time checkbox is used to enable or disable input of time. The time will default to 00:00 if not entered. The timeline will be centered at the date and time. When the dialog is opened it is the date and time at the center of the screen that is displayed.
Fit Year will expand or contract the timeline so that it shows one whole year. The year shown is the year that is in the center of the screen.
Fit Month and Fit Day has the same functionality as the Fit Year except that the timeline will display one single month and one single day.
Export to Image
Sometimes you want to take your timeline and use it somewhere else. For example include it in an OpenOffice document or put it on a website. The Export to Image feature ( File Export to Image... ) lets you save the current view of the timeline as an image on disk. The default format is PNG. Other supported formats are BMP.
Enable Logging
If you are having a problem with &app; it can be helpful to enable logging to get more information about your problem.
In order to enable logging, &app; must be started from the command line like this:
python <path-to-timeline-directory>/src/main.py --log-level 0 --log-file log.txt
Windows users might also need to specify the path to the python exe file which is normally something like C:\Pyhon25\python.exe.
This command will print a lot of information and also write it to the file log.txt.
To exlude debug messages, change the 0 to 20 in the log level parameter.
